verb.description: (with reference to a ship or boat) move by hauling in a hawser attached to a small anchor dropped at some distance.
examples: I kedged the dinghy to the port
most of the smaller boats had to kedge for a while

noun.description: A small anchor used to reposition a ship or boat by having the anchor's hawser hauled in.

origin: Late 15th century: perhaps a specific use of dialect cadge bind, tie.
